channel.title: Sport | Mail Online
channel.description: Explore MailOnline's latest sport news including football, F1, rugby, NFL and more! Sign up for newsletters to get breaking news delivered to your inbox.

item.title: West Ham vs Manchester United, Premier League LIVE: Can Jose Mourinho's side seal second place?
item.description: Manchester United could seal a second-place finish in the Premier League with a win over West Ham on Thursday night. Follow the action as it happens with Sportsmail's TOM FARMERY.

item.title: Liverpool stars past and present arrive at end-of-season awards with Salah set to clear up
item.description: Liverpool players past and present have arrived en masse ahead of the club's end-of-season awards ceremony. Anfield played host to the annual event as accolades were handed out for various honours.

item.title: Liverpool man Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain gives positive update on knee surgery 'success'
item.description: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain has handed Liverpool a boost after confirming surgery on his injured knee has been a 'success.' He watched on from hospital as the Reds battled in Rome.

item.title: Ian Holloway sacked by QPR with Steve McClaren to take over
item.description: Ian Holloway has been sacked by Queens Park Rangers with Steve McClaren poised to take over the managerial hot seat. QPR have swiftly terminated Holloway's contract at Loftus Road.

item.title: Yaya Toure ready to turn down big-money offers from China and the Middle East
item.description: CHRIS WHEELER: Yaya Toure will turn down lucrative offers from China and the Middle East to continue playing for less money in the Premier League.

item.title: Ireland hope to make history for the first time in 141 years with Test win vs Pakistan
item.description: LAWRENCE BOOTH IN MALHAIDE: William Porterfield has called on his cricketers to exploit Pakistani nerves as they try to become the first side for 141 years to win their first Test.

item.title: How much is at stake going into the final week of the Premier League?
item.description: With just one round of Premier League fixtures left of the current season it may appear on the surface that there is very little to play for. However, there are plenty of financial bonuses still up for grabs.

item.title: Huddersfield's survival means no newly-promoted team in England's top five divisions were relegated
item.description: The Terriers' survival, secured with Wednesday's draw at Chelsea, means not one of the 16 teams promoted into the top five divisions in English football were relegated in their first season at a higher level.

item.title: Chelsea charged by FA for failing to control players and coaches
item.description: Chelsea have been charged by the Football Association after players and coaches surrounded referee Lee Mason at half-time during Wednesday night's 1-1 draw with Huddersfield.

item.title: Romario's World Cup advice for Gabriel Jesus: 'Have lots of good sex'
item.description: Jesus is expected to lead the Brazilian attack — just as Romario did in 1994 when the South American nation won the fourth of their five World Cup titles. Romario ended USA 94 with the Golden Ball.

item.title: Crystal Palace eyeing Everton midfielder James McCarthy
item.description: The Republic of Ireland international is on course to return for the second week of pre-season training and is aiming to be fit to play for the start of the new season after braking his leg in January.

item.title: Simon Yates takes Giro d'Italia lead on stage six
item.description: Britain's Simon Yates has taken the overall lead in the Giro d'Italia after finishing second on stage six behind his Mitchelton-Scott team-mate Esteban Chaves.

item.title: Hundreds of F1 fans flock to get autographs as Lewis Hamilton and Co arrive ahead of the Spanish GP
item.description: Dedicated Formula One fans turned out in their masses on Thursday afternoon as they welcomed Lewis Hamilton and others ahead of the Spanish Grand Prix weekend.

item.title: Former Barcelona midfielder Arda Turan hit with record 16-match ban for shoving linesman
item.description: The Turkish Professional Football Discipline Board announced the decision to ban Turan for 16 games on Thursday after he was sent off for shoving the linesman Erdinc Sezertam.

item.title: It's back! Street sign bearing Sir Alex Ferguson's name returns outside Old Trafford
item.description: With news emerging on Wednesday that Sir Alex Ferguson no longer needs intensive care following emergency surgery on a brain haemorrhage, Manchester United fans were given another boost.

item.title: Manchester City lead chase for £53m Napoli star Jorginho
item.description: Jorginho is set to become the subject of a top-six battle this summer, with Napoli willing to sell the midfielder for around £53million. Manchester City are believed to be frontrunners.

item.title: Brad Shields is like Chris Robshaw but with slightly better hands
item.description: Brad Shields is the man whose selection for England has caused the most drama in the past few months. Here, Sportsmail gives the lowdown on the bearded wonder.

item.title: Slavisa Jokanovic says Ryan Sessegnon talk will not distract his team
item.description: Fulham boss Slavisa Jokanovic will not let transfer speculation over Ryan Sessegnon distract his side's play-off campaign. The Cottagers are preparing for a huge semi-final with Derby.

item.title: Manchester City goalkeeper Ederson smashes longest ever drop kick as records continue to tumble
item.description: Powerful Brazilian goalkeeper proudly displayed his official Guinness World Record plaque on social media after achieving the feat in a training session on Thursday.

item.title: 'Atrocious' Richard Keys and Andy Gray slammed for lavishing praise on controversial Qatar World Cup
item.description: Richard Keys and Andy Gray spoke to Peter Reid after the ex-England international visited with Hassan Al-Thawadi, the Qatari official who is head of the 2022 World Cup committee.

item.title: 'I had to control the animal inside me,'... Arsene Wenger reveals
item.description: Arsene Wenger says he had to curb his animalistic instincts to make it to the top of the managerial game. The Arsenal boss will leave the club at the end of the season - ending a 22-year reign there.

item.title: Former Chelsea youth player opens up on alleged racial abuse
item.description: A former Chelsea youth player has outlined alleged racial abuse at the club which turned his life into a 'living nightmare'. The player resorted to not turning up, and had his contract terminated.

item.title: Real Sociedad to have face of Xabi Prieto as club badge against Leganes
item.description: The phrase one-man team has been bandied about a lot in football but Real Sociedad have taken the meaning to a whole new level.

item.title: West Ham add concourse displays of captains, crests and record breakers to London Stadium
item.description: Sportsmail's photographs show what will be in place for Thursday night's Premier League clash with Manchester United for the first time, located in the East Stand.

item.title: Huddersfield go on wild night out after securing Premier League safety
item.description: Huddersfield players abandoned their late flight back north after securing their Premier League status with a draw at Chelsea on Wednesday night and instead went on a wild night out in London.

item.title: Wayne Rooney and I watched his entire wedding on DVD at the 2010 World Cup, reveals Jermain Defoe
item.description: The Three Lions will be based in the quiet village of Repino, some 30 miles from St Petersburg, raising concerns that they could suffer from cabin-fever as the tournament progresses.

item.title: Lionel Messi wears 'Celia 10' shirt as Barcelona celebrate mothers
item.description: Mother's Day is celebrated in Spain on the first Sunday in May, but Barcelona chose to hold the stunt three days later rather than ahead of last weekend's Clasico draw with Real Madrid.

item.title: Ross Barkley where does he go now at Chelsea?
item.description: Ross Barkley was once billed as a future world-beater. Pundits purred over his Paul Gascoigne-like style of play and Romelu Lukaku said he was a 'blessing' to play with.

item.title: Judy Murray says son Andy doing 'everything he can' to be fit for Wimbledon
item.description: Judy Murray says 'fingers crossed' the former world number one will be ready for the grass-court season and insists he still has a lot of things he wants to achieve in tennis before calling it quits.

item.title: Barcelona Women striker Toni Duggan hangs out with Luis Suarez and Philippe Coutinho
item.description: Barcelona and England Women striker Toni Duggan looked delighted as she posed for a photo with former Liverpool duo Luis Suarez and Philippe Coutinho on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Simona Halep defeated in straight sets by Karolina Pliskova at quarter final stage of Madrid Open
item.description: Simona Halep was the two-time defending champion and on a 15-match winning streak at the clay-court tournament but came undone on Thursday as she lost 6-4, 6-3 in Madrid.

item.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic enjoys dinner at A-list hotspot and stars on The Late Late Show with James Corden
item.description: Former Manchester United striker was spotted entering the popular rooftop seafood restaurant Catch LA on Wednesday, when he was also a guest on Briton's late-night CBS talk show.

item.title: Christopher Schindler: Huddersfield achieving Premier League survival is 'unbelievable'
item.description: David Wagner's Terriers followed up a 0-0 draw at champions Manchester City with a 1-1 draw at Chelsea on Wednesday night which confirmed their Premier League status for a second season.

item.title: John O'Shea to make final Republic of Ireland appearance against USA
item.description: Martin O'Neill kept one eye on the future with a first senior squad call-up for Shamrock Rovers striker Graham Burke as John O'Shea prepared to make his final international appearance.

item.title: Arsene Wenger had us hanging off his every word right up until his final press conference
item.description: Nobody holds court quite like Arsene Wenger. The M25 is unforgiving during the morning rush hour; getting to Wenger's 8.45 press conferences was infuriating. Never simple to get to London Colney.

item.title: Manchester United boast world football's most valuable brand worth £1.4bn
item.description: Brand Finance's findings show that the Old Trafford club's brand power is worth a massive £1,357m — £404m more than Manchester City, who are the second most valuable English club brand.

item.title: Real Madrid star Gareth Bale admits he would love to be a golfer if he wasn't a footballer
item.description: Ahead of the 2018 Players Championship this week at Sawgrass, Real Madrid star Gareth Bale teamed up with PGA Tour to test his short game by taking part in the Mug Challenge.

item.title: Juventus icon Buffon consoles Donnarumma after Milan keeper's shocker
item.description: The teenage stopper palmed a long-range Douglas Costa effort into his own net for goal No 2, before dropping an easy catch onto the toe of Medhi Benatia who poked home Juve's third of the game.

item.title: England appoint Scott Wisemantel as attack consultant for three-match tour of South Africa
item.description: The Red Rose, who are looking to bounce back from their Six Nations misery, will play the Springboks in three Tests in Johannesburg, Bloemfontein and Cape Town next month.

item.title: England appoint Scott Wisemantel as attack consultant for three-match tour of South Africa
item.description: The Red Rose, who are looking to bounce back from their Six Nations misery, will play the Springboks in three Tests in Johannesburg, Bloemfontein and Cape Town next month.

item.title: Spurs must kick on and Arsenal's form is embarrassing - TACKLE KEOWN
item.description: Sportsmail columnist Martin Keown answered your questions after Huddersfield secured safety and Tottenham booked their place in the top four. See all of his answers here.

item.title: Kyle Edmund beats David Goffin in straight sets to reach Madrid Open quarter finals
item.description: MIKE DICKSON IN MADRID: Backing up big wins can prove difficult for younger players but Kyle Edmund was equal to the task when he followed up his defeat of Djokovic by taking out Goffin.

item.title: Danny Cipriani returns to England squad for South Africa tour
item.description: Danny Cipriani has earned a dramatic recall for England and will tour South Africa in June. The 30-year-old fly-half has been in dazzling form for Wasps this season

item.title: Arsenal target Massimiliano Allegri quashes claims his work is done at Juventus
item.description: Juventus coach Massimiliano Allegri has refuted suggestions that his work is done at the club as they close in on a fourth double in as many seasons under his leadership.

item.title: Arsenal owner Stan Kroenke has appointed a rookie like Mikel Arteta and Patrick Vieira before
item.description: Arsenal have cut their managerial shortlist down to five candidates with relative rookies Mikel Arteta and Patrick Vieira both in the running to replace their former boss Arsene Wenger.

item.title: Carlos Carvalhal set to leave Swansea at the end of the season
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY RIATH AL-SAMARRAI: Carlos Carvalhal will not be in charge of Swansea City next season after failing to keep them in the Premier League, Sportsmail can reveal.

item.title: Konstantinos Mavropanos became the 118th Arsenal player to be sent off during Arsene Wenger's reign
item.description: As the Frenchman prepares to step down after 22 years as manager, Mavropanos was the 118th - and likely the last - player to be sent off on Wenger's watch.

item.title: Pep Guardiola hails Leroy Sane's display against Brighton following title celebrations
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has hailed Leroy Sane's 'outstanding' performance against Brighton in the Premier League following his party antics just three days earlier.

item.title: Beating Liverpool 'piece of cake', says Real Madrid's Francisco Gento
item.description: Real are bidding to become the first team to win three consecutive European Cups since the tournament was re-named the Champions League and Gento is confident ahead of the final.

item.title: Being black isn't stopping Moore getting West Brom job, it's their misguided desire for experience
item.description: Steven Gerrard's in a job, Darren Moore isn't quite. There's plenty of West Brom and Rangers in this week's 5 POINTS plus the court of social media, Xherdan Shaqiri and Sir Alex Ferguson.

item.title: Danny Cipriani has been deservedly picked for England tour of South Africa based on form and merit
item.description: ENGLAND SQUAD VERDICT BY CHRIS FOY: Eddie Jones' decision to recall Danny Cipriani for England's tour of South Africa is a triumph for selection on merit; rather than on reputation.

item.title: Bellerin defends vegan lifestyle in the wake of criticism by Alan Brazil
item.description: 'Get a steak down you pal! Bellerin, get that steak down you raw! That'll help,' Brazil cried following their Europa League defeat by Atletico Madrid -- when Diego Costa held off Bellerin to score.

item.title: Boston Celtics book their place in NBA Eastern Conference finals
item.description: Boston Celtics beat the Philadelphia 76ers 114-112 on Wednesday night to advance to the Eastern Conference finals. Jayson Tatum stop scored with 25 points, while Jaylen Brown contributed 24.

item.title: Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone ignoring Antoine Griezmann transfer talk
item.description: Atletico Madrid manager Diego Simeone insists that he is not paying attention to reports linking star striker Antoine Griezmann with a move to Barcelona and is focused on the Europa League final.

item.title: New Zealand blast England selectors after allowing Brad Shields to join South Africa tour
item.description: New Zealand are livid that Kiwi-born flanker Brad Shields will tour with England this summer - but have begrudgingly allowed his release while firing shots at the RFU.

item.title: Morocco fear dirty tricks by FIFA in bid to stage 2026 World Cup
item.description: CHARLES SALE - SPORTS AGENDA: It has emerged that Morocco are concerned about a possible dirty tricks campaign which they consider has been waged by FIFA.

item.title: Angling for promotion: Lee Bowyer has swapped his carp lake for the stress of Charlton's dugout
item.description: The downside for Lee Bowyer if he takes Charlton to the League One play-off final at Wembley on May 27 is having to delay a fishing holiday to the south of France.

item.title: Toure heaps praise on Sheik Mansour after final Man City home game
item.description: The Ivory Coast midfielder has been a pivotal figure in turning the Abu Dhabi vision into reality during his eight years at Manchester City, and he was given a fitting send-off on Wednesday night.

item.title: Sanches reveals emoji just hours before Swansea are all but-relegated
item.description: Sanches, who joined the Swans on loan from Bayern Munich last summer, posted on Twitter on Wednesday afternoon showing off his own emoji.The timing of the post has angered fans.

item.title: David Moyes is heading for West Ham exit... and wants a top 8 club next
item.description: The Scot, whose side face Manchester United Thursday, signed a short-term contract when he succeeded Slaven Bilic and has achieved the target he was set last November.
item.media:credit: West Ham United via Getty Images

item.title: Wayne Rooney tells Everton that he wants to join DC United
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY MATT LAWTON AND LAURIE WHITWELL: Wayne Rooney has told Everton he wants to join DC United, with a £12.5million deal now close to being agreed.

item.title: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola challenges his record breakers after Brighton win
item.description: The champions beat Brighton 3-1 at the Etihad to set new records for points, wins and goals scored. City can raise the bar even higher when they face Southampton in the final game on Sunday.

item.title: Jose Mourinho says Manchester United have players who will never make the grade
item.description: Jose Mourinho admits Manchester United are lumbered with players he knows will never be up to the standards needed at Old Trafford. Mourinho will make his changes this summer.

item.title: Stoke City eye £10m move for Dwight Gayle
item.description: Stoke City are keen on Newcastle striker Dwight Gayle. Manager Paul Lambert is already making plans for next season and believes Gayle can score the goals to get them back into the Premier League.

item.title: Celtic boss Brendan Rodgers left cursing negative tactics of Kilmarnock after stalemate
item.description: Brendan Rodgers claimed Celtic would have struggled to break down 'a team of firemen' if they had played in the ultra-defensive formation Kilmarnock used at Parkhead,

item.title: Surrey offer to host 100-ball competition for the ECB at the Oval but await confirmation
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Surrey have offered to host an experimental 100-ball match at The Oval in September – but are awaiting a decision from the ECB.

item.title: Arsene Wenger hits out at 'imaginative' referee in defeat against Leicester
item.description: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger hit out at referee Graham Scott after the Gunners extended their winless away run to seven league games with a 3-1 defeat to Leicester on Wednesday night.
item.media:credit: Leicester City FC via Getty Imag

item.title: Ian Poulter on the up after last year's agony at Players Championship
item.description: As he contemplates a summer filled with exciting possibilities, it’s easy to forget the dire predicament Poulter faced at the 2017 Players Championship.

item.title: Antonio Conte adds to doubt over Chelsea future after huge blow to Champions League hopes
item.description: In the wake of Chelsea's draw with Huddersfield Town, manager Antonio Conte will have done nothing to ease speculation around his future by avoiding questions on the matter.

item.title: Southampton open talks with Mark Hughes over a new long-term deal
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY IAN LADYMAN: Mark Hughes, who is contracted until the end of the season, has had talks about staying at Southampton

item.title: Pochettino says Tottenham cannot continue to celebrate top-4 finishes
item.description: Spurs secured Champions League football with Wednesday night’s 1-0 win over Newcastle at Wembley and will finish in the top three for a third straight year with victory against Leicester.

item.title: Mourinho uncertain Paul Pogba will be at Manchester United next year
item.description: Jose Mourinho 'thinks' Paul Pogba will still be a Manchester United player next season amid fresh speculation over the Frenchman's future at Old Trafford with Sportsmail revealing he could be sold.

item.title: Ex-West Ham head of recruitment apologises for African player comments
item.description: The former head of recruitment at West Ham made the mistake of trying to blame the African Cup of Nations for not wanting to sign more players from the continent.

item.title: Robin Goodfellow's racing tips: Best bets for Thursday, May 10
item.description: Sportsmail's racing expert Robin Goodfellow dishes out his tips ahead of Thursday's meetings at Chester, Chelmsford City, Wincanton, Huntingdon and Worcester.

item.title: Sir Alex Ferguson is out of intensive care following brain haemorrhage
item.description: Manchester United said the former United boss will continue his recovery in hospital after undergoing emergency surgery at the weekend. United released a statement on Twitter on Wednesday evening.

item.title: How Stoke's 'farcical' transfer policy led to Premier League relegation
item.description: Stoke City were a team of grafters who achieved the dream of reaching the Premier League, but a decade on the side's core values have disappeared on their way back down to the Championship.

item.title: Liverpool fans rescued by Kiev locals after Champions League hotel price hike
item.description: Ukrainians have come to the rescue of Liverpool fans struggling to find accommodation for the Champions League final in Kiev after hotels started charging thousands of pounds a night.

item.title: Young Rascal becomes as short as 10-1 for the Investec Derby
item.description: Young Rascal did enough to suggest next month's Investec Derby will not just be an Aidan O'Brien private party when overcoming inexperience to run out a half-length winner.

item.title: Salford City's joint managers quit after pay disputes
item.description: JACK GAUGHAN: When the celebratory moment came, when Salford City secured an historic promotion to the fifth tier of English football for the very first time, Gary Neville found out via a stranger.

item.title: Matchroom Boxing set to announce new transatlantic broadcast deal
item.description: Matchroom Boxing will on Thursday announce details of a new transatlantic broadcast deal which Eddie Hearn believes will have a seismic impact

item.title: Yaya Toure leaves Man City a wealthy man with the club rich in silverware
item.description: MIKE KEEGAN: The 34-year-old arrived on a lucrative five-year deal and extensions have followed. He will depart a very wealthy man. But City are now rich in silverware. It is barely believable.
